name: Escape the Void (Trentendo)
description:
ESCAPE THE VOID

You are an alien trapped in an abandoned space colony in the middle of nowhere. You only have one goal in mind, be the first to reach the remaining escape pod.

In Escape the Void, you must find your way to the escape pod, to save your species and escape the colony forever. You must defeat your fellow aliens and sabotage their attempts to best you to be the last alien standing.

SETUP

• Gather 2 to 4 players (recommended 4) 

• Set up the board with each corner having an ‘alien’ piece on the start tile. 

• Each player takes five tiles and place them in a stairway pattern around their ‘alien’ piece, face down. 

• Once all these tiles are face down, turn them over. Do not manipulate these tiles until the game allows it via ability or event cards. 

• Each player then draws one character card from the character deck. This card will determine the player’s unique movement ability. 

• These abilities are not secret. Players are free to share their ability with other players. 

Deciding Who Goes First 

Whoever rolls the highest number on the numbered dice, goes first. Re-roll if a tie occurs.

If you're using Tabletopia, players will have access to a ‘end turn’ mechanic which you will need to turn on turn-based clockwise for more convenience when playing

GAMEPLAY

1. Roll the two dice 

2. Pick up a tile, place it anywhere on the board, and then turn it over to face up 

(Must connect to another tile) (on Tabletopia, make sure to be parallel with board to place tiles) 

3. Move your character up to the number on the dice (tetrahedral dice) 

4. If you come across another player engage in combat 

5. If you land and finish your turn on a tile for an event or tile, pick up corresponding card and use it 

6. Use your modification (regular dice) (see modification cheat sheet) 

7. Pick up and play the event/tile card in the case you collected one 

8. Use your character’s special ability 

9. That is the end of your turn! (For a more detailed look at the ruleset, checkout the rules book in the downloads folder)
